description:
Fixed EPG matching to properly balance HD preference with call sign quality.

Issues fixed:
- US | 5050 - FYI: now prefers FYIChannelHD(FYIHD).us over FYI(FYISD).us
- US | 5051 - GET TV: now prefers getHD(GETHD).us over get(GETTVS).us
- US | 5079 - Lifetime Movie: now prefers LMNHD(LMNHD).us
- US | 5086 - MGM+: now prefers MGM+HD(MGMHD).us over MGM+West(MGMW).us
- US | 5092 - Ovation: now prefers OvationHD(OVATNHD).us over Ovation(OVATION).us
- US | 5097 - Pursuit: now prefers PursuitChannelHD(PURSTHD).us over PursuitUP(PRSTUP).us
- US | 5102 - Reelz: now prefers ReelzChannelHD(REELZHD).us over REELZ(VIZREEL).us
- US | 5113 - Tastemade Travel: now prefers TastemadeTravel(TMTRAVEL).us (actually this one should still work from v65)
- US | 5116 - TCM: now prefers TurnerClassicMoviesHD(TCMHD).us over TCM.us
- US | 5125 - TV Land: now prefers TVLandHD(TVLNDHD).us over TVLand(TVLAND).us

Root cause:
Previous logic (v65) prioritized call sign match quality over HD preference. This caused issues where non-HD variants with slightly better call sign matches (e.g., TVLAND exact match) were preferred over HD variants with good-but-not-exact call signs (e.g., TVLNDHD).

Solution:
Combined HD preference with call sign scoring. Now:
- When comparing HD vs non-HD, prefer HD UNLESS:
  - The non-HD has a MUCH better call sign (score difference >= 2)
  - AND the HD variant has a poor call sign (score <= 1)
- This means NOSEY (score 3) still beats VIZNOSE-HD (score 0)
- But TVLNDHD (score 2) now beats TVLAND (score 3) because diff is only 1

comments.author: lecaptainc
comments.text:
Fixed FYI matching to prefer exact call sign match over suffix-stripped match.

Issue: 'FYI' was matching 'FYI(FYISD).us' over 'FYI(FYI).us' because both call signs matched after stripping the SD suffix.

Fix: Added priority levels for call sign matching:
1. Exact call sign match (FYI = fyi) - highest priority
2. Base call sign match after stripping suffix (FYIHD → fyi) - second priority  
3. No match - lowest priority

Now 'FYI(FYI).us' (exact match) is correctly preferred over 'FYI(FYISD).us' (base match).

Changes:
1. Added 'newGroupName' field to createChannel API call spec
2. Updated stageCreateChannel to accept newGroupName parameter  
3. Updated commit logic to:
   - Collect all unique new group names from staged createChannel operations
   - Create those groups first before creating channels
   - Map group names to their new IDs
   - Use the mapped ID when creating channels
4. Updated App.tsx handleBulkCreateFromGroup to pass newGroupName instead of calling API directly

Now when the user selects 'Create new group':
- The group creation is staged along with the channels
- The group is only created in Dispatcharr when the user clicks 'Done' (commits)
- If the user discards, no orphaned group is left in Dispatcharr

description:
Fixed EPG matching to prefer call signs that better match the channel name.

Issues fixed:
- US | 5089 - Nosey: now prefers Nosey(NOSEY).us over Nosey(VIZNOSE).us
- US | 5097 - Pursuit: now prefers PursuitChannelHD(PURSTHD).us over PursuitUP(PRSTUP).us
- US | 5102 - Reelz: now prefers ReelzChannelHD(REELZHD).us over REELZ(VIZREEL).us
- US | 5113 - Tastemade Travel: now prefers TastemadeTravel(TMTRAVEL).us over TastemadeTravel(VIZTASTR).us
- US | 5116 - TCM: now prefers TurnerClassicMoviesHD(TCMHD).us over TCM.us
- US | 5117 - The Cowboy Channel: now prefers HD variant
- US | 5120 - The Pet Collective: now prefers ThePetCollective(PETCOLL).us over ThePetCollective(XALPTCL).us

Root cause:
The call sign matching logic only compared call signs when both EPG entries had them, and was positioned after HD preference in sort priority. Call signs like VIZNOSE, VIZREEL, XALPTCL don't contain the channel name, while NOSEY, REELZHD, PETCOLL do.

Solution:
- Added a call sign scoring function that rates how well the call sign matches the channel name:
  - Score 3: exact match (call sign equals normalized name)
  - Score 2: call sign starts with normalized name (e.g., REELZHD starts with REELZ)
  - Score 1: significant common prefix (60%+ overlap)
  - Score 0: no meaningful match
- Moved call sign matching BEFORE HD preference in sort priority
- Now handles entries without call signs gracefully (score 0)

title: Batch related operations into single undo/redo point

Now moving channels between groups or reordering within a group creates a single undo point regardless of how many individual channel updates occur.

title: Smarter undo batching for cross-group channel moves
description: Implemented smarter undo batching for cross-group channel moves. Now creates separate undo entries for each logical phase: (1) Move channels to target group, (2) Shift existing channels in target group if inserting at a position, (3) Renumber remaining channels in source group if closing gaps. This gives users 1-3 undo steps instead of one giant batch, allowing them to step through the operation logically.

title: Show undo entry count instead of individual operation count

title: Fix modifiedChannelIds not updating correctly on undo/redo operations

Fixed incorrect M3U stream count calculation in Stats tab.

Problem: Stats tab was showing 15 total streams instead of 10 when an M3U account with max_streams=5 had a profile with max_streams=5.

Root cause: When M3U accounts have profiles (from linked accounts), the profiles array includes ALL accounts (primary + linked). The code was incorrectly adding account.max_streams PLUS the sum of all profile max_streams, causing double-counting of the primary account.

Solution: Modified calculation to use ONLY the sum of active profile max_streams when profiles exist (since they already include the base account). Falls back to account.max_streams when no profiles exist.

Changed in StatsTab.tsx (lines 523-546):
- If profiles exist and have active profiles, use profileStreams sum only
- Otherwise, use account.max_streams as fallback
- This prevents double-counting the primary account's stream limit

description:
Fixed group ordering issue where groups were appearing out of order instead of being sorted by their lowest channel number.

Root cause:
The groupOrder state was being auto-initialized with whatever order the API returned channelGroups, which was not necessarily sorted by channel number. This auto-initialized order then took precedence over natural channel number sorting, causing groups to appear in the wrong order. Additionally, when new groups were created, they were not added to groupOrder, so they appeared after all groups that were in groupOrder, even if their channel numbers were lower.

Changes made in ChannelsPane.tsx:

description:
Fixed /api/channel-groups/with-streams endpoint by rewriting the logic.

The previous fix (v0.7.20039) used channel_group_id as a filter parameter when fetching channels, but this parameter doesn't exist in the Dispatcharr API. This caused the endpoint to not work correctly.

New approach:
1. Fetch all channel groups and build a lookup map (group_id -> group)
2. Fetch all channels in a single pass
3. For each channel that has streams, record its channel_group ID in a set
4. Return only the groups whose IDs are in that set

This is simpler, more efficient (one pass through channels instead of N passes), and doesn't rely on unsupported API parameters. Added detailed logging to track progress.

## Feature Request
Add WebSocket integration with Dispatcharr to show real-time EPG refresh progress like the Dispatcharr UI does.

## Current State
ECM polls the REST API every 2 seconds during refresh, but can only see:
- status: 'fetching' or 'parsing'
- last_message: Only updated when operation completes

## Desired State
Show real-time progress messages like Dispatcharr's UI:
- 'Downloading' with speed/progress
- 'Extracting' for compressed files
- 'Parsing channels' with batch progress
- 'Parsing programs' with percentage

## Technical Details
- Dispatcharr WebSocket endpoint: ws://host:port/ws/
- Message type: 'update' with 'data' containing progress info
- Actions: 'downloading', 'extracting', 'parsing_channels', 'parsing_programs'
- Updates sent via channel_layer.group_send() to 'updates' group

title: Improve regional variant detection for WestCoastFeed etc

comments.author: lecaptainc
comments.text:
Fixed regional variant detection to catch more patterns like WestCoastFeed.

Issue: 'MotorTrend' was matching 'MotorTrend(WestCoastFeed)(MTPHD).us' over 'MOTORTRENDHD(MTHD).us' because 'WestCoastFeed' wasn't being detected as a regional variant.

Fix: Expanded the regional pattern to match more variants:
- Old: /\((Pacific|East|West|Central|Mountain)\)/i
- New: /\((Pacific|East(?:ern)?(?:Feed)?|West(?:ern)?(?:Coast)?(?:Feed)?|Central|Mountain)\)/i

Now matches:
- Pacific
- East, Eastern, EastFeed, EasternFeed
- West, Western, WestCoast, WestCoastFeed, WesternFeed
- Central
- Mountain

Since 'MotorTrend' has no region hint, it defaults to preferring East, and the WestCoastFeed variant is now correctly deprioritized.

Analyzed multi-select filter patterns in ChannelsPane and StreamsPane.

KEY DIFFERENCES that complicate extraction:
1. ChannelsPane: Works with ChannelGroup objects, selectedGroups is number[] (IDs)
   - Groups have additional data (channel counts, names)
   - Sorting logic includes selected items first
2. StreamsPane: Works with string[] group names directly
   - Simple string array, no object structure
   - Different sorting logic

DUPLICATION EXISTS but contexts differ:
- Search input + clear button (same)
- Select All / Clear All buttons (same logic, different data types)
- Checkbox list with filtering (same pattern, different item types)

ATTEMPTED SOLUTION:
Created useMultiSelectFilter hook with generic types to handle both:
- TItem: the source items (ChannelGroup[] or string[])
- TKey: the selected keys (number[] or string[])
- getKey/getSearchableText callbacks for flexibility

PROBLEM:
The hook becomes complex with generic types and callbacks, making it harder to understand than the inline implementations. The TypeScript types become convoluted (useMultiSelectFilter<ChannelGroup, number> vs useMultiSelectFilter<string, string>).

RECOMMENDATION:
The current inline implementations are ~40 lines each but are clear and easy to understand. A generic hook would save ~30 lines total but add cognitive overhead and indirection. Given that:
1. Only 2 use sites exist
2. Logic is straightforward
3. Contexts are meaningfully different
4. Hook would require complex generics

Suggest DEFERRING this extraction. The cost/benefit doesn't justify it compared to other P2 work.

comments.author: lecaptainc
comments.text:
Fixed E! channel matching to prefer E!EntertainmentTelevisionHD(EHD).us over E.us.

Root cause: 'E!' normalizes to just 'e', and 'E.us' was an exact match for 'e'. The EPG entry 'E!EntertainmentTelevisionHD(EHD).us' normalizes to 'eentertainmenttelevisionhd' which would only match via prefix matching, but prefix matching was skipped when exact matches existed.

Two-part fix:
1. For very short normalized names (1-2 chars), also try prefix matching even when exact matches exist - single letters are too generic to rely on exact matching alone
2. For short names, don't prioritize exact matches over prefix matches in sorting
3. Added special punctuation matching - prefer EPG entries that share special chars like '!' with the original channel name

Now 'E!' will match 'E!Entertainment' because:
- Both 'E.us' (exact) and 'E!EntertainmentTelevisionHD' (prefix) are found
- The '!' in the channel name prefers the EPG entry with '!' in its TVG-ID

- 'we' follows (a letter follows after 'a')

- 'thebobrosschannel' → 'bobrosschannel' (14 chars) - long enough, strips → 'bobrosschannel' ✓

- handleGroupDragStart: Sets dataTransfer for group drags with custom drag images

A generic useStreamDragDrop hook would need to handle:
1. Drag source logic (StreamsPane)
2. Drop target logic (ChannelsPane)
3. Application-specific dataTransfer formats
4. Application-specific callbacks (onStreamGroupDrop)
